isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS PT PACER - 1991 - OPERATION - SENSOR INPUT

svcprocinfo.para: The PT Pacer Control Unit receives an AC (alternating current) voltage from the vehicle speed sensor and the engine speed sensor. Both sensors have two pair of leads and are dual coil sensors. Even though the resistance of the two coils in each sensor is different, the leads are interchangeable. The resistance of one coil is between 900-1100 ohms and the other coil is between 1200-1450 ohms.

svcsubproc.title: Vehicle Speed Sensor
svcsubproc.para: The vehicle speed sensor is located at the rear of the transmission. The sensor contains a permanent magnetic, which creates a magnetic field, and as the speedometer gear rotates through the magnetic field, the field is broken, creating the AC voltage. One lead connects to the PT Pacer Control Unit harness and the other lead connects to the engine harness speedometer circuits.

svcsubproc.title: Engine Speed Sensor
svcsubproc.para: The engine speed sensor is located in the engine flywheel housing and the sensor magnetic field is broken by the flywheel teeth as it rotates. One lead connects to the PT Pacer Control Unit harness and the other connects to the engine harness tachometer circuits.
